aside.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Iâ€™ve been setting aside a few pounds each week.
One of the rooms was set aside for a yoga class.
Try to set aside a few hours a week for exercise.
Could you put this cake aside for me?
aside.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: moved to one side or away from you
aside.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
She swept her thick hair aside.
aside.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: left to be considered or dealt with later, or not considered and dealt with at all
aside.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He brushed aside criticisms of his performance.
Leaving aside the heat, we really enjoyed our holiday.
You must put aside your pride and call her.
aside.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used to show that something you have just said is not as important as what you are going to say next
aside.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: These problems aside, we think the plan should go ahead.
aside.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: words spoken by an actor to the people watching a play, that the other characters in the play do not hear
aside.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a remark made in a low voice that you only intend particular people to hear
aside.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a remark or story that is not part of the main subject of a speech
aside.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: I should add, as an aside, that the younger the child, the faster they learn.
